items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Article 9.20 submission and recommendation: Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all District assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of the full load.
		 
Article 9.20 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all Districts assigned service during the college semester for which the y are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.   
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.20 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
		 
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 6157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District  Article 15.2.1 submission and recommendation:
		 
Article 15.2.1 Full-time unit members' overload assignment  for compensation and/or overload banking shall be based on a separate contract which shall normally be limited to 6 (six) units or 40% of a full load. Exceptions to this maximum overload shall be negotiated with the Faculty Association.
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 15.2.1 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.

items.item_details:
The Utilities Infrastructure project at EVC is currently in construction. Construction is also about to begin for the Photovoltaic (PV) Array project at  EVC.  It is cost effective to add the conduit to the existing infrastructure project for the future connection of the PV Array.  This prevents double digging in the same spot on campus and is less expensive than a change order to the PV project.   Thermal Mechanical, Inc.  is the contractor for the Utilities Infrastructure Project and they have submitted Change Order#1, in the amount of $61,450, to furnish and install  5" conduit infrastructure as required for the PV Array connection.
		 
		 
Original Contract Amount
         $1,684,985
Change in Contract Value for Change Order #1
             $ 61,450
Revised Contract Value
         $1,746,435
		 
The Vice-Chancellor, Administrative Services has reviewed the cost submitted for this authorization and recommends approval.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order #1, as a change in contract scope with Thermal Mechanical, Inc. for the Utilities Infrastructure project at EVC.

items.item_details:
The District successfully passed Measure G-2010 on November 2, 2010.  Among the Evergreen Valley College projects approved by the Board was an energy efficiency project.  The Board approved an initial design-build agreement with SunPower on April 12, 2011 in order to secure an incentive amount of $1,413,594 through the California Solar Initiative Program in cooperation with Pacific Gas & Electric ("PGE").  The total budget for this project per the approved Bond Project List is $8,968,090.
Change Order #1 allows the District to retain 5% of the amount of each contractor invoice as retention, which will be invoiced and paid separately upon satisfactory completion of the project. 
	 
Change Order #2 includes the expansion of the photovoltaic system from a total peak output capacity of 1131.52 kWp to 1,541.1 kWp, a net increase of 409.6 kWp utilizing the existing Measure G-2010 Energy Efficiency project budget.  The original agreement with SunPower Corporation includes a fifteen-year Operations & Maintenance Agreement and a fifteen-year Performance Guarantee.  The Operations & Maintenance Agreement and Performance Guarantee will both be amended to include the expanded system.
	 
Original Contract Amount
     $6,096,785
Change Order #1
     $             0
Change Order #2
     $2,294,528
Revised Contract Amount
     $8,391,313
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order #1 and #2 as a change in contract scope with SunPower for the photovoltaic system at Evergreen Valley College.

The Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges (ACCJC), at its meeting on January 11-13, 2011, reviewed the Evergreen Valley College’s (EVC) and San Jose City College's (SJCC) institutional Self Study Reports and the reports of the evaluation teams that visited the colleges in October 2010.  The Commission acted to issue a Warning to EVC and Probation to SJCC and asked the colleges to address every recommendation, correct the deficiencies and resolve the issues identified in the Commission’s letters of January 31, 2011.  The Colleges are required to complete Follow-Up Reports by October 15, 2011.  Those reports will be followed up with a visit by Commission representatives on November 8-9, 2011.
	 
Chancellor Cepeda and presidents Barbara Kavalier and Henry Yong will be presenting the follow-up reports for both colleges.
	 
The Follow Up Reports are coming to the Board of Trustees for information and review with final approval for submission to ACCJC at the October 11, 2011 Board meeting.
